author: ind.igo
content:
hey all. can i ask basic questions here?

Was wondering regarding validity/fraud proofs, it makes sense that the L2 must post proofs that there was no shenanigans with any of the L1 assets that were bridged over. But does the rollup also post proofs for all other state that settles on the L2? Like does Optimism need to post proofs for a token like OP, which originated and settles on Optimism?

From what I understand, a rollup "inheriting security" is mostly the rollup ensuring valid state transitions on the L1 assets on the rollup, and the L1 doesn't necessarily have any concept of the tokens originating on the L2. Please let me know if im incorrect here.

author: ajsutton
content: There's no reason the bridge can't support bridging native L2 tokens back to L1 in which case you'd need a proof of the state of those native L2 tokens.

author: ind.igo
content: I see. But, if for some reason I wanted to make a chain with only a 1 way bridge of assets from the L1 (native L1 token to an L2, but no L2 tokens back to L1), would the L2 need to post proofs for non-L1 assets?

author: ajsutton
content: You likely don't need proofs at all in that case. The L2 reads its data from L1 so bridging from L1 to L2 doesn't require proofs - the L2 can see the actual transaction sent to L1 and work with that directly to make the funds available on L2.
